intro: Lappula arida, commonly known as desert lappula, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Eurasia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves that help reduce water loss. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its botanical features make it a hardy species suited for marginal environments.
